meanings.definition: A pair of posts mounted on the deck of a ship for securing lines.
meanings.sent1: The sailor tied the rope to the bitts to keep the boat in place.
meanings.sent2: The captain instructed the crew to fasten the mooring lines to the bitts.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull perched on the bitts, pretending to be a lookout.
meanings.sent4: The bitts stood like loyal guards, holding the ship steady in the storm.
meanings.sent5: The worn bitts creaked under the strain of the heavy ropes, a testament to their strength.

meanings.definition: A strong post on a pier or wharf to which lines are secured.
meanings.sent1: The fishermen tied their boat to the sturdy bitts before unloading their catch.
meanings.sent2: The dockworkers relied on the bitts to keep the ships safely anchored.
meanings.sent3: The playful children pretended the bitts were knights guarding the harbor.
meanings.sent4: The bitts stood tall like sentinels, watching over the bustling port.
meanings.sent5: The weathered bitts bore the marks of countless ropes, a silent testament to their service.

meanings.definition: A pair of horizontal timbers on a ship used for supporting the windlass.
meanings.sent1: The crew members secured the anchor chain to the bitts before hoisting it up.
meanings.sent2: The bitts played a crucial role in the smooth operation of the windlass.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat tried to balance on the bitts, thinking it was a narrow bridge.
meanings.sent4: The bitts worked tirelessly, ensuring the windlass could raise the anchor efficiently.
meanings.sent5: The shiny bitts gleamed in the sunlight, a vital part of the ship's machinery.
